dungeon

Class Dungeon

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeon.Dungeon

  • public class Dungeon
extends java.lang.Object
    A dungeon is a series of rooms connected to each other. There is a beginning and an end, and always a path between them.
    There are different types of rooms in the dungeon, including treasure rooms, monster rooms, traps, ... The dungeon contains a player who starts in the beginning room.
    Author:
    Lucas Moura de Oliveira

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dungeon(Player player)
      Creates a new dungeon, with a new blank entrance room and a new command manager

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dungeon

        public Dungeon(Player player)
        Creates a new dungeon, with a new blank entrance room and a new command manager
        Parameters:
        player - the character controlled by the user

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the main loop of the dungeon, asking an user input at each turn, resolving its actions and displaying their result on the console. The function ends when the player reaches the end of the dungeon or dies.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Returns:
        the player in the dungeon

      • getInformations

        public java.lang.String getInformations()
        Returns the status of the game, consisting of :
        - the informations of the room in which the player is
        - a small text to ask the player what does he want to do
        - a prompt symbol
        Returns:
        the players informations for the current turn

      • getQuestion

        public java.lang.String getQuestion()
        Returns:
        the question displayed to the user

      • getPrompt

        public java.lang.String getPrompt()
        Returns:
        the prompt symbol

      • interpreteCommand

        public void interpreteCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Resolve the action the user entered in the console and plays the turn
        Parameters:
        command - the user's input, consisting of an action and potential parameters

      • enterNewRoom

        public void enterNewRoom(Room room)
        Makes the player enter a new room, sets his last visited room, and resolves the action happening when he enters the new room.
        Parameters:
        room - the new room the player is about to enter.

      • gameIsFinished

        public boolean gameIsFinished()
        Returns whether or not the game is finished
        Returns:
        true if the player reached the exit OR if he died, false otherwise

      • gameIsLost

        public boolean gameIsLost()
        Returns:
        true if the player is dead

      • gameIsWon

        public boolean gameIsWon()
        Returns:
        true if the player is standing on an exit

      • getCurrentRoom

        public Room getCurrentRoom()
        Returns:
        the current room in which the player is

      • getCommandManager

        public CommandManager getCommandManager()
        Returns the command manager of the dungeon. It includes a list of all the commands the player can use
        Returns:
        the command manager of this dungeon
